items.title: Netflix Removes Support for Casting From Most Devices

items.title: Pushing the Boundaries of Video Innovation Through the Power of Collaboration
items.summary: At Harmonic, we believe that innovation in video delivery starts with deep collaboration.  Our work with NVIDIA over the years has been instrumental in unlocking the full potential of NVENC and NVDEC to enable advanced capabilities like AI-driven noise reduction, upscaling and frame rate doubling. These enhancements deliver stunning video quality for our customers across multiple codecs, including AVC, HEVC, AVI, and even for MV-HEVC for spatial videos.  The video quality enhancements are further optimized by Harmonic’s EyeQ™ technology that leverages-trained Convolutional Neural Network models for rate control and mode decisions.

items.title: Brownfield MDU Broadband: Unlocking Revenue with Existing Infrastructure
items.summary: From Burden to Breakthrough Brownfield multi-dwelling unit ( MDUs) are often viewed as complex and costly to upgrade. In reality, many properties already have existing coax or fiber that can be leveraged, and residents in those buildings are demanding more bandwidth. With the right approach and technology, these legacy buildings can be transformed from perceived burdens into strategic assets that support new revenue and sustainable growth.

items.title: Unified DOCSIS 4.0
items.summary: Improving quality of experience for each subscriber is the next frontier in subscriber satisfaction and retention. Unified DOCSIS 4.0 takes DOCSIS 4.0 to a new level, offering a revolutionary solution that empowers operators with access to both Full Duplex (FDX) and Frequency Division Duplex (FDD)  DOCSIS 4.0 technologies. With virtualized solutions, operators can leverage the valuable combination of edge compute infrastructure with cloud services to adapt and perform for best quality of experience.

items.title: OLT and ONT Interoperability: A New Path Forward
items.summary: The Evolution of Fiber Broadband Networks     As fixed-line fiber optic networks continue their rapid expansion, operators face a persistent challenge: achieving true interoperability between optical network terminals (ONTs) or optical network units (ONUs) and optical line terminals (OLTs). While passive optical network (PON) technologies have advanced significantly, the promise of seamless multi-vendor integration remains largely unfulfilled.   .

items.title: Harmonic Leads Broadband Industry Transformation

This has resulted in heightened economic and competitive pressures for broadband operators. Choosing the right technology partner with the necessary expertise, leadership and business stability will determine the success of their business evolution and longevity. .

items.title: How Cloud-Based Playout-to-Delivery Drives Cost Efficiency
items.summary: More and more broadcasters and content owners are moving their playout workflows to the public cloud. A recent survey of over 200 media and entertainment executives show that 30 percent of them have considered migrating to cloud playout for broadcast. The main reasons driving this decision include scalability, better end-user experience, the willingness to upgrade technology, shorter time to market of services and cost reduction.
